thread.title: South Yorkshire Police welcome newest members to force | Calendar
thread.title_full: South Yorkshire Police welcome newest members to force | Calendar - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: South Yorkshire Police welcome newest members to force | Calendar
text:
South Yorkshire Police have welcomed the newest members to their force following the successful delivery of litter R.
South Yorkshire Police welcome the newest members to the force - Litter R Credit: South Yorkshire Police Police dog Izzy gave birth to her second litter of healthy puppies at the home of a puppy walker in late December.
The eight German Shepard puppies, made up of four boys and four girls, were born under the South Yorkshire Police puppy-breeding scheme, set up in 2007.
All of the puppies, who are now eight weeks old, have received their first round of shots and will soon be ready to take their first steps outside and begin exploring the world.
Over the coming weeks they will be paired to their puppy walkers and will begin their journey on the South Yorkshire Police training programme.
The scheme was brought into force to breed the next generation of working dogs, and since its introduction success has followed. Part of this success was PD Izzyâ€™s previous litter of 12 pups, who now work in different roles in Norfolk, Humberside, Gibraltar, West Midlands and the prison service.
Last updated Tue 31 Jan 2017 South Yorkshire
